skill.author: Claude Flow Team

security_audit.summary: Pure documentation skill containing only SKILL.md with MCP tool usage patterns. No executable code, scripts, or malicious patterns. Contains CLI command references for Claude Flow integration, which is expected for orchestration skills.

content.value_statement: Managing complex distributed workflows across multiple AI agents is challenging without structured orchestration patterns. This skill provides advanced swarm topologies, agent specialization strategies, and fault tolerance mechanisms for coordinating parallel AI agent operations at scale.
actual_capabilities: Configure mesh, hierarchical, star, and ring swarm topologies for different use cases
Spawn specialized agents with custom capabilities for research, development, and testing
Implement parallel task execution with dependency management and error handling
Manage cross-session memory and state persistence for swarm coordination
Monitor swarm health, collect metrics, and optimize agent performance
Create reusable workflows with event-driven triggers and automation rules
limitations: Requires Claude Flow MCP server to be configured and running
Does not include built-in AI model capabilities - orchestrates existing Claude tools
Complex swarms may require significant system resources for agent coordination

use_cases.title: Parallel research coordination
use_cases.description: Run simultaneous web research, data analysis, and synthesis across multiple specialized agents

use_cases.title: Full-stack development swarm
use_cases.description: Coordinate backend, frontend, database, and DevOps agents for complete application development

use_cases.title: Distributed testing execution
use_cases.description: Run unit, integration, E2E, and security tests in parallel across specialized testing agents

prompt_templates.title: Initialize basic swarm
prompt_templates.prompt: Initialize a swarm with mesh topology and 4 agents to research [topic]. Use adaptive strategy for parallel information gathering.

prompt_templates.title: Build full-stack app
prompt_templates.prompt: Create a hierarchical development swarm with 6 agents: architect, backend dev, frontend dev, database engineer, tester, and DevOps. Build a [application type] with [features].

prompt_templates.title: Run comprehensive tests
prompt_templates.prompt: Initialize a star testing swarm with 5 agents: unit tester, integration tester, E2E tester, performance tester, and security tester. Run comprehensive tests on [project].

prompt_templates.title: Optimize swarm patterns
prompt_templates.prompt: Analyze current swarm performance metrics. Optimize topology for [workload type]. Implement fault tolerance and auto-scaling for [number] concurrent agents.

output_examples.input: Create a hierarchical development swarm with 5 agents to build a REST API with authentication
output: Agent team spawned: Architect (coordinator), Backend Developer, Frontend Developer, QA Engineer, DevOps Engineer
Phase 3: Testing and validation in progress

best_practices: Choose the right topology for your use case: mesh for research, hierarchical for development, star for testing, ring for pipelines
Assign specific, non-overlapping capabilities to each agent to maximize parallel efficiency
Implement fault tolerance with memory persistence and state snapshots for recovery from failures
anti_patterns: Using star topology for research tasks requiring peer-to-peer agent communication
Spawning agents without defined capabilities leading to task duplication and conflicts
Running parallel execution without monitoring resource usage during complex workflows

faq.question: What Claude Flow version is required?
faq.answer: Claude Flow alpha version 2.0.0 or higher is required. Install with npm install -g claude-flow@alpha.

faq.question: What is the maximum agent count?
faq.answer: Agent count is configurable per swarm. Practical limits depend on system resources. Start with 4-8 agents for most workflows.

faq.question: How does this integrate with existing MCP tools?
faq.answer: This skill uses claude-flow MCP tools for swarm coordination. Other MCP tools can be called by individual agents during task execution.

faq.question: Is data stored securely?
faq.answer: Memory storage uses configurable namespaces with optional TTL. Sensitive data should not be stored in shared memory without encryption.

faq.question: What happens if an agent fails?
faq.answer: Fault tolerance can be enabled for automatic recovery. Failed tasks can be retried or reassigned to healthy agents depending on configuration.

faq.question: How is this different from basic agent spawning?
faq.answer: Swarm orchestration adds topology management, coordinated parallel execution, cross-agent communication, and persistent state across sessions.
